TEI.2.document_title: Stephen F Austin to Ayuntamiento of San Felipe, 01-17-1834

barker_notes.barker_summary: Austin to Ayuntamiento of San Felipe, Monterey, January 17, 1834. Announcing arrest and advising tranquillity.
barker_notes.barker_footnotes: From Advocate of the People's Rights, extra, Mar. 27, 1834. For this paper see the editor's "Notes on Early Texas Newspapers," Southwestern Historical Quarterly, XXI, 139. See García to Austin, Dec. 7, 1833.

*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to Ayuntamiento of San Felipe, Monterey, January 17, 1834. Announcing arrest and advising tranquillity.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Monterey*/location_mentioned*, *date_mentioned n="01-17-1834">Jan. 17, 1834*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*To the *person_mentioned*Ayuntamiento of *location_mentioned*San Felipe de Austin*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*:*/p*
*p*I have been arrested by an order from the *person_mentioned*minister of war*/person_mentioned*, and leave soon for *location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned*to answer to a charge made against me, as I understand, for writing an officio to the *person_mentioned*Ayuntamiento[s] of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*, dated *date_mentioned n="10-02-1833">2d October*/date_mentioned* last, advising, or rather recommending that they should consult amongst themselves for the purpose of organizing a *person_mentioned*local government*/person_mentioned* for *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*, in the event that no remedies could be obtained for the evils that threatened that country with ruin.*/p*
*p*I do not in any manner blame the *person_mentioned*government */person_mentioned*for arresting me, and I particularly request that there may be no excitement about it.*/p*
*p*I give the advice to the *person_mentioned*people */person_mentioned*there that I have always given, keep quiet, discountenance all revolutionary measures or men, obey the *person_mentioned*state authorities*/person_mentioned* and laws so long as you are attached to *location_mentioned*Coahuila*/location_mentioned*, have no more conventions, petition through the legal channels, that is through the *person_mentioned*ayuntamiento */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*chief of department*/person_mentioned*, harmonize fully with the *person_mentioned*people of *location_mentioned*Bexar */location_mentioned*and *location_mentioned*Goliad*/location_mentioned*,*/person_mentioned* and act with them.*/p*
*p*The *person_mentioned*general government*/person_mentioned* are disposed to do everything for *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned* that can be done to promote its prosperity and welfare that is consistent with the constitution and laws, and I have no doubt the *person_mentioned*state government*/person_mentioned* will do the same if they are applied to in a proper manner.*/p*
*p*It will be remembered that I went to *person_mentioned*Mexico */person_mentioned*as a *person_mentioned*public agent*/person_mentioned* with specific instructions, and as such, that it was my duty to be governed by them, and by the general wish of the people as expressed to me. Also, that when I left in *date_mentioned n="04-xx-1833">April*/date_mentioned*, the general wish did express itself for the separation from *location_mentioned*Coahuila */location_mentioned*and the forming of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned* into a *location_mentioned*state of this confederation*/location_mentioned*. Also, that there was a determination to organize a *person_mentioned*local government*/person_mentioned* at all hazards, if no remedy could be obtained.*/p*
*p*I have in all my acts conformed to this public wish of the people, so far as I was informed of it, and when I despaired of obtaining any remedy, as I did the beginning of *date_mentioned n="10-xx-1833">October*/date_mentioned*, I deemed it to be my duty as an *person_mentioned*agent */person_mentioned*to inform the people so; and believing as I did, that they would organize, I also considered that it would be much better to do so, by a harmonious consultation of the *person_mentioned*Ayuntamiento[s]*/person_mentioned* than by a popular commotion. These were my reasons for the recommendation given in that officio; also, the result of the civil war was thought to be doubtful.*/p*
*p*I understand, and I rejoice to hear it, that public opinion has settled down on a more reasonable basis, and that the most of the *person_mentioned*Ayuntamientos of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* have expressed their wish to proceed in a legal manner to seek redress. I ought to have been informed of this change, but I was not, and knew nothing of it to a certainty, untill the *date_mentioned n="11-05-1833">5th of November*/date_mentioned*, so that up to that time I acted under the impressions I had when I left *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*in *date_mentioned n="04-xx-1833">April*/date_mentioned*. Since then I have not moved the state question.*/p*
*p*The past events in *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*necessarily grew out of the revolution of *location_mentioned*Jalappa*/location_mentioned*, which overturned the constitution and produced the counter revolution of *location_mentioned*Vera Cruz*/location_mentioned*, which extended over the whole country, and involved *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*with the rest. It is well known that it was my wish to keep *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*, and particularly the *location_mentioned*colony*/location_mentioned*, out of all revolution, and I tried to do so, but the flame broke out in my absence from *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*, in *date_mentioned n="06-xx-1832">June 1832*/date_mentioned*, and since then all has been completely disjointed. A current was set in motion by the general events of the civil war all over the *location_mentioned*nation*/location_mentioned*, and under the circumstances, *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*could not avoid being agitated by it. No one can be blamed in any manner for what has happened since *date_mentioned n="06-xx-1832">June, 1832*/date_mentioned*, in *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*- it was inevitable—neither was it possible for me to avoid being drawn into the whirlpool. It was my duty to serve the country as an *person_mentioned*agent */person_mentioned*if requested to do so; and as an *person_mentioned*agent */person_mentioned*it was my duty to obey my instructions as expressed to me.*/p*
*p*I have long since informed the *person_mentioned*Ayuntamientos of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* of the repeal of the law of*date_mentioned n="04-06-1830"> April, 1830*/date_mentioned*, and of the favorable and friendly disposition of the government, and by this, I of course rescinded, or annulled, the recommendation of *date_mentioned n="10-02-1833">2d October*/date_mentioned*, for that was predicated on the belief that nothing would be done, and that the result of the civil war then pending was even doubtful, since then all has changed for the better, and public opinion in *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*has become sound, and shaken off the excitement that necessarily grew out of the past agitations.*/p*
*p*Under these circumstances the prospects of *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*are better than they ever have been. The national revolution is ended, a constitutional government exists, the *person_mentioned*people */person_mentioned*are obedient to the *person_mentioned*government*/person_mentioned* and laws, everywhere. Be the same in *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*, and have no more excitements, tolerate no more violent measures, and you will prosper and obtain from the *person_mentioned*government */person_mentioned*all that reasonable men ought to ask for.*/p*
*p*The last year has been one of calamities for *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*, floods, pestilence, and commotions, I hope the present year will be more favorable. I request that you will have this letter published for general information, and also the enclosed copy of the answer given to me by his Excellency the minister of relations. You will see by this answer the very favorable and friendly disposition of the *person_mentioned*general government*/person_mentioned* to make a state or a territory of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*, and do everything else within its constitutional powers for the good of that *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*I consider my agency for *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*as terminated, but this will not prevent me from doing all I can for the good of that *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*, on my own individual responsibility.*/p*
*p*Respectfully your most ob't sert.,*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Stephen F. Austin*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*/div1*
